children.description: Returns a (possibly empty) collection of all children of this widget.
Returns a (possibly empty) collection of all children of this widget that match the selector.

find.description: Returns a (possibly empty) collection of all descendants of this widget.
Returns a (possibly empty) collection of all descendants of this widget that match the selector.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: An object in the format `{Selector: {property: value, property: value, ... }, Selector: ...}`

apply.description: Applies the given properties to all descendants that match the associated selector(s).

parent.description: Returns the parent of this widget.

appendTo.description: Appends this widget to the given parent. The parent widget must support children (extending *Composite*).

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The properties and target values to animate.

animate.description:
Starts an animation that transforms the given properties from their current values to the given ones. Supported properties are *transform* and *opacity*. Supported options are:

- *delay* - time until the animation starts in ms, defaults to `0`
- *duration* - in ms,
- *easing* - one of `linear`, `ease-in`, `ease-out`, `ease-in-out`
- *repeat* - number of times to repeat the animation, defaults to `0`
- *reverse* - `true` to alternate the direction of the animation on every repeat.
- *name* - no effect, but will be given in animation events

dispose.description: Removes this widget from its parent and destroys it. Also disposes of all its children. Triggers a `remove` event on the parent and a `dispose` event on itself. The widget can no longer be used.

isDisposed.description: Returns `true` if the widget has been disposed, otherwise `false`.

id.description: A string to identify the widget by using selectors. Id's are optional. It is strongly recommended that they are unique within a page.

enabled.description: Whether the widget can be operated.

layoutData.description: Specifies how the widget should be arranged in a layout. See [Layout](../layout.md).

font.description: The font used for the widget.

backgroundImage.description: An image to be displayed on the widget's background. If the image is smaller than the widget, it will be tiled.

bounds.description: The actual location and size of the widget, relative to its parent. This property is read-only.

opacity.description: Opacity of the entire widget. Can be used for fade animations.

transform.description: Modifications to the widget's shape, size, or position. Can be used for animations. **Note:** In Android the *transform* property does not affect the *bounds* property, while it does so in iOS.

highlightOnTouch.description: Whether the entire widget should be highlighted while touched.

id.description: Direct access to the value of the property of the same name. May be used instead of `widget.get("id");` Do not use this field to change the value, instead use `widget.set("id", id);`.

cid.description: An application-wide unique identifier automatically assigned to all widgets on creation. Do not change it.

type.description: The exact string that was used to create this widget using the `tabris.create` method.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value of this given property.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: This is the options object given to the [`set`](#set) method.

change:{property}.description: Fired when the given property has changed. Change events for specific properties will only be documented separately if they may be triggered without calling `set`.

tap.description: Fired once when a finger briefly touched the widget.

longpress.description: Fired after pressing a widget for a specific amount of time (about a second), and again on lifting the finger.

pan.description: Fired continuously after a finger touching the widget moved for a certain distance.

pan:{direction}.description: Fired when a finger starts moving in the given direction. Values for {direction} are: `left`, `right`, `up`, `down`.

swipe:{direction}.description: Fired when a finger moves quickly in the given direction. Values for {direction} are: `left`, `right`, `up`, `down`.

touchstart.description: Fired when a widget is touched. See [Touch Events](../touch.md).

touchmove.description: Fired repeatedly while swiping across the screen.

touchend.description: Fired when a touch ends on the same widget than it started on.

touchcancel.description: Fired instead of touchend when the touch ends on another widget than it started on.

parameters.name: bounds
parameters.description: The new value of the [*bounds*](#bounds) property.

resize.description: Fired when the widget's size has changed. You can use this event to apply new [*layoutData*](#layoutData).

animationstart.decription: Fired when an animation starts playing.

animationend.description:: Fired when an animation has completed.

dispose.description: Fired when the widget is about to be disposed. At this point the widget and its children are still accessible.
